marker.ph: /// Datatype To Store Talents. ...
/// Initialises Talents ...
/// Activates Talents, returns true if talent activation was successful, false if it is not. ...
/// Deactivates talents, returns true if talent deactivation was successful, false if it is not. ...
/// Writes talents from talent dictionary, to object above. ...
/// Refreshes talents of object above by reading the binary file. ...
/// Converts Class Dictionary of Weapon and Boolean to Dictionary of String and Boolean. ...
/// The Possible Energy Events ...
/// Energy Event Structure ...
/// Add this component to a character and it'll be able to run ...
/// At the beginning of each cycle, we check if we've pressed or released the run button ...
/// Causes the character to start running. ...
/* if the player presses the run button and if we're on the ground and not crouching and we can move freely, ... */
/// Causes the character to stop running. ...
/// Stops all run sounds ...
/// Adds required animator parameters to the animator parameters list if they exist ...
/// At the end of each cycle, we send our Running status to the character's animator ...
/// A class meant to be overridden that handles a character's ability. ...
/// On Start(), we call the ability's intialization ...
/// Gets and stores components for further use ...
/// Adds required animator parameters to the animator parameters list if they exist ...
/// Internal method to check if an input manager is present or not ...
/// Called at the very start of the ability's cycle, and intended to be overridden, looks for input and calls met ...
/// The first of the 3 passes you can have in your ability. Think of it as EarlyUpdate() if it existed ...
/// The second of the 3 passes you can have in your ability. Think of it as Update() ...
/// The last of the 3 passes you can have in your ability. Think of it as LateUpdate() ...
/// Override this to send parameters to the character's animator. This is called once per cycle, by the Character ...
/// Changes the status of the ability's permission ...
/// Override this to specify what should happen in this ability when the character flips ...
/// Override this to reset this ability's parameters. It'll be automatically called when the character gets kille ...
/// Plays the ability start sound effect ...
/// Plays the ability used sound effect ...
/// Stops the ability used sound effect ...
/// Plays the ability stop sound effect ...
/// Registers a new animator parameter to the list ...
/// Override this to describe what should happen to this ability when the character respawns ...
/// Override this to describe what should happen to this ability when the character respawns ...
/// On enable, we bind our respawn delegate ...
/// On disable, we unbind our respawn delegate ...
/// Added This Class Just In Case We Choose To Passively Modify Power With Depletion Rates Based on Charges. (Rem ...
/* Setting Depletion Rate ... */
/* Finding Object Called GameManager ... */
/// This persistent singleton handles the inputs and sends commands to the player. ...
/// On Start we look for what mode to use, and initialize our axis and buttons ...
/// Turns mobile controls on or off depending on what's been defined in the inspector, and what target device we' ...
/// Initializes the buttons. If you want to add more buttons, make sure to register them here. ...
/// Initializes the axis strings. ...
/// On LateUpdate, we process our button states ...
/// At update, we check the various commands and update our values and states accordingly. ...
/// If we're not on mobile, watches for input changes, and updates our buttons states accordingly ...
/// Called at LateUpdate(), this method processes the button states of all registered buttons ...
/// Called every frame, if not on mobile, gets primary movement values from input ...
/// Called every frame, if not on mobile, gets secondary movement values from input ...
/// Called every frame, if not on mobile, gets shoot axis values from input ...
/// If you're using a touch joystick, bind your main joystick to this method ...
/// If you're using a touch joystick, bind your secondary joystick to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your left/right arrows to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your secondary down/up arrows to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your secondary left/right arrows to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your down/up arrows to this method ...
/// Various static methods used throughout the Infinite Runner Engine and the Corgi Engine. ...
/// All possible states for a button. Can be used in a state machine. ...
/// Takes an axis and returns a ButtonState depending on whether the axis is pressed or not (useful for xbox trig ...
/// IM button, short for ...
/// Add this bar to an object and link it to a bar (possibly the same object the script is on), and you'll be abl ...
/* This class will pilot the CorgiController component of your character. ... */
/// Initializes this instance of the character ...
/// Gets and stores input manager, camera and components ...
/// Initializes the animator parameters. ...
/// Gets (if it exists) the InputManager matching the Character's Player ID ...
/// Sets the player ID ...
/// This is called every frame. ...
/// We do this every frame. This is separate from Update for more flexibility. ...
/// Calls all registered abilities' Early Process methods ...
/// Calls all registered abilities' Process methods ...
/// Calls all registered abilities' Late Process methods ...
/// This is called at Update() and sets each of the animators parameters to their corresponding State values ...
/// Handles the character status. ...
/// Freezes this character. ...
/// Unfreezes this character ...
/// Use this method to force the controller to recalculate the rays, especially useful when the size of the chara ...
/// Called to disable the player (at the end of a level for example. ...
/// Makes the player respawn at the location passed in parameters ...
/// Flips the character and its dependencies (jetpack for example) horizontally ...
/// Forces the character to face left or right on spawn (and respawn) ...
/// Forces the character to face right or left ...
/// Called when the Character dies. ...
/// On revive, we force the spawn direction ...
/// OnEnable, we register our OnRevive event ...
/// OnDisable, we unregister our OnRevive event ...
/// The various states you can use to check if your character is doing something at the current frame ...
/// The possible Movement States the character can be in. These usually correspond to their own class, ...
/// Added This Class Just In Case We Choose To Passively Modify Power With Depletion Rates Based on Charges. (Rem ...
/* Setting Depletion Rate ... */
/* Finding Object Called GameManager ... */
/// A list of the possible Corgi Engine base events ...
/// A type of events used to signal level start and end (for now) ...
/// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="MoreMountains.CorgiEngine.CorgiEngineEvent"/> struct. ...
/// A list of the methods available to change the current score ...
/// A type of event used to signal changes to the current score ...
/// Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="MoreMountains.CorgiEngine.CorgiEnginePointsEvent"/> struct. ...
/// A list of the methods availble to change the number of chips ...
/// Initialises a new instance of the chips struct. ...
/// A list of the methods available to change the current score ...
/// The game manager is a persistent singleton that handles points and time ...
/// On Start(), sets the target framerate to whatever's been specified ...
/// this method resets the whole game manager ...
/// Adds the points in parameters to the current game points. ...
/// use this to set the current points to the one you pass as a parameter ...
/// use this to set the remove points to the one you pass as a parameter ...
/// use this to set chip points ...
/// use this to add power ...
/// use this to remove power ...
/// use this to set power ...
/// use this to update charges, usually in all events where power is modified. ...
/// sets the timescale to the one in parameters ...
/// Resets the time scale to the last saved time scale. ...
/// Pauses the game or unpauses it depending on the current state ...
/// Unpauses the game ...
/// Adds an amount of Energy To Total Game Energy ...
/// Sets Amount of Energy ...
/// Sets Rate of Energy Regeneration ...
/// Gets Rate of Energy Regeneration ...
/// Gets Energy ...
/// Catches MMGameEvents and acts on them, playing the corresponding sounds ...
/// Catches CorgiEngineEvents and acts on them, playing the corresponding sounds ...
/// Catches CorgiEnginePointsEvents and acts on them, playing the corresponding sounds ...
/// Catches CorgiEngineChipsEvents and acts on them, playing the corresponding sounds ...
/// Catches CorgiEngineEnergyEvents and acts on them ...
/// Catches PowerEvent and acts on them ...
/// Catches CorgiEngineTimeScaleEvents and acts on them, playing the corresponding sounds ...
/// OnEnable, we start listening to events. ...
/// OnDisable, we stop listening to events. ...
/// Stating Global Variables ...
/// Initialises all global variables. ...
/// Calculates Energy Ratio In Order To Produce Correct Number for Bar. ...
/// Handles Passively Increasing Energy By an Amount Every Second. Rate handled by PassiveEnergyIncreaseRate ...
/// Handles Energy Changes when Sprinting ...
/// Handles Visual Bar Changing. ...
/// This persistent singleton handles the inputs and sends commands to the player. ...
/// On Start we look for what mode to use, and initialize our axis and buttons ...
/// Turns mobile controls on or off depending on what's been defined in the inspector, and what target device we' ...
/// Initializes the buttons. If you want to add more buttons, make sure to register them here. ...
/// Initializes the axis strings. ...
/// On LateUpdate, we process our button states ...
/// At update, we check the various commands and update our values and states accordingly. ...
/// If we're not on mobile, watches for input changes, and updates our buttons states accordingly ...
/// Called at LateUpdate(), this method processes the button states of all registered buttons ...
/// Called every frame, if not on mobile, gets primary movement values from input ...
/// Called every frame, if not on mobile, gets secondary movement values from input ...
/// Called every frame, if not on mobile, gets shoot axis values from input ...
/// If you're using a touch joystick, bind your main joystick to this method ...
/// If you're using a touch joystick, bind your secondary joystick to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your left/right arrows to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your secondary down/up arrows to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your secondary left/right arrows to this method ...
/// If you're using touch arrows, bind your down/up arrows to this method ...
/// Type of Attack This Talent Replaces (As Outlined in Documentation) ...
/// Type of Weapon That This Talent Applies To ...
/* Talent Class denoting the name, ability, whether the talent is active, type of weapon, type of attack to repl ... */
/// Talent Class denoting the name, ability, whether the talent is active, type of weapon, type of attack to repl ...
/// Public interface for the state machine. ...
/// StateMachine manager, designed with simplicity in mind (as simple as a state machine can be anyway). ...
/// If you set TriggerEvents to true, the state machine will trigger events when entering and exiting a state. ...
/// Creates a new StateMachine, with a targetName (used for events, usually use GetInstanceID()), and whether you ...
/// Changes the current movement state to the one specified in the parameters, and triggers exit and enter events ...
/// Returns the character to the state it was in before its current state ...
